intro: Barbosella crassifolia var. aristata, commonly known as the coastal barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are adapted to store water, reflecting its ability to thrive in arid and saline environments. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its unique adaptations to harsh climates. Its morphology and growth habits make it well-suited for coastal dunes and sandy soils.
